title: Tuna Noodle Casserole
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Tuna Noodle Casserole a try. This recipe serves 6. One portion of this dish contains around 18g of protein, 14g of fat, and a total of 293 calories. For $1.2 per serving, this recipe covers 15% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. It will be a hit at your Autumn event. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 45 minutes. If you have , chicken broth, old cheddar, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the sherry you could follow this main course with the Dark Chocolate Fudge Merlot Cupcakes as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 45%. This score is solid. Similar recipes are Tuna Noodle Casserole 2.0, Tuna Noodle Casserole, and Tuna Noodle Casserole.

winePairing.pairingText: Tuna works really well with Merlot, Pinot Noir, and rosé Wine. Though fish is often paired with white wine, 'meatier' fish like tuna can absolutely go with red wine. A Rosé will also pair nicely, particularly if your tunan is prepared with ingredients better suited to a white wine. The Nickel & Nickel Harris Vineyard Merlot with a 4.2 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 40 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Nickel & Nickel Harris Vineyard Merlot
productMatches.description: Bright red fruits, candied blueberry, Santa Rosa plum and menthol aromas all blend together to intoxicate the nose as the 2016 Harris Vineyard Merlot wafts from the glass. On the palate, a juicy and fruity entry is supported by chewy tannins and a balancing acidity, creating lush layers that coat the tongue and produce a soft, elegant finish.

instructions: Directions1Preheat oven to 375F and butter a shallow baking dish.2Heat oil and butter in a large skillet set over medium heat. Add the onions and saut for a few minutes, until soft. Add the mushrooms and some salt and pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, until they give off their liquid. Add the sherry and cook until most of the liquid has cooked off.3Add the flour and stir until the mushrooms are well coated (this will help prevent lumps); add the stock and milk and stir (or whisk) until it bubbles, then once it is boiling cook for a full minute, to reach the flour's full thickening potential.4Meanwhile, cook the noodles in a big pot of water. Drain them and put them into the bottom of the baking dish. Stir the tuna into the mushroom sauce and pour it overtop.5Toss together (or pulse in the food processor) the bread crumbs and cheeses and sprinkle them evenly over the top. Bake for 30 minutes, until golden, crisp and bubbly.Makes:  Serves 6.

steps.step: Heat oil and butter in a large skillet set over medium heat.
Add the onions and saut for a few minutes, until soft.
Add the mushrooms and some salt and pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, until they give off their liquid.
Add the sherry and cook until most of the liquid has cooked off.3

Add the flour and stir until the mushrooms are well coated (this will help prevent lumps); add the stock and milk and stir (or whisk) until it bubbles, then once it is boiling cook for a full minute, to reach the flour's full thickening potential.4Meanwhile, cook the noodles in a big pot of water.

Drain them and put them into the bottom of the baking dish. Stir the tuna into the mushroom sauce and pour it overtop.5Toss together (or pulse in the food processor) the bread crumbs and cheeses and sprinkle them evenly over the top.
